jobs.title: Principal Software Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Suzy

Suzy is an AI-first SaaS platform transforming how businesses capture consumer insights. With Suzy 3.0, we’re building the next generation of our platform—anchored around Suzy Speaks, Suzy Signals, and AskSuzy—to deliver real-time, mobile-first feedback loops that help the world’s biggest brands move at the speed of culture.

The Role

We’re looking for a Staff/Principal-level Engineer who combines systems thinking with hands-on execution. This is not an ivory tower role: you’ll lead through code, experimentation, and pragmatic decision-making. You’ll design and implement critical systems, anticipate technical dependencies, and drive alignment across product and engineering teams as we build Suzy 3.0.

You’ll be a key technical leader working on foundational systems for real-time consumer signals, conversational AI, and high-scale data pipelines.

What You’ll Do

  • Design & Architect: Define and evolve the architecture of Suzy 3.0, focusing on scalability, resilience, and performance.

  • Build & Lead by Example: Write production-quality code across services and components; mentor others through code reviews and pairing.

  • Cross-Functional Alignment: Partner with Product, Data, Security, and Infra teams to anticipate dependencies and make pragmatic tradeoffs.

  • Experiment & Deliver: Drive proof-of-concepts in areas like AI-driven natural language processing, mobile-first engagement, and real-time analytics.

  • Own Key Systems: Lead initiatives for:

    • Suzy Speaks → mobile-first conversational feedback, voice/text interfaces, sentiment analysis.

    • Suzy Signals → real-time market data ingestion, trend detection, and reporting pipelines.

    • AskSuzy → AI-powered Q&A workflows, semantic search, and insights automation.

  • Scale & Secure: Ensure reliability, compliance, and observability at scale.

Technologies We Use (and you may touch)

  • Backend: .NET (C#), Node.js, TypeScript, Python

  • Data & Analytics: Azure SQL, Cosmos DB, PostgreSQL, Airflow, MongoDB

  • AI/ML (optional): LLM orchestration (OpenAI/Anthropic, LangChain), vector search (Pinecone/Weaviate/FAISS), sentiment models

  • Frontend & Mobile: React, Angular, Blazor, MAUI

  • Infra: Kubernetes, Docker, Azure (AKS, Storage, Functions, API Management)

  • Observability & Ops: Azure Monitor + Log Analytics + Application Insights (primary); plus OpenTelemetry, Terraform/Pulumi, GitHub Actions or Azure Pipelines, Helm/Argo CD/Flux

Who You Are

  • 10+ years of engineering experience with increasing scope, including Staff/Principal responsibilities.

  • Proven ability to design, build, and operate large-scale distributed systems.

  • Fluent in at least one systems-level language (C#/.NET, Go, Rust, or similar) and one scripting language (TypeScript, Python, etc.).

  • Strong understanding of data pipelines, real-time event streaming, and system observability.

  • Experience building AI/ML-enabled applications or integrating third-party AI/LLM APIs is a plus.

  • Anticipates dependencies and aligns teams without blocking delivery.

  • A builder’s mindset: pragmatic, hands-on, comfortable with ambiguity, thrives in startup environments.

  • Strong communicator who influences through clarity and code.

Benefits:

  • We take care of our employees and their families. We have generous health dental and vision benefits, and our 401K plan vests immediately

  • A friendly, fun, and collaborative work environment that allows for frequent exposure to executives

  • The opportunity to make an immediate impact as a part of a fast-growing company

  • The target base compensation for this role is $180,000 - $200,000 / yr.

Suzy is an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to ensure all people feel supported and connected at work.

Suzy is committed to protecting its customers, employees, partners, and the company as a whole, from damaging acts that are intentional or unintentional. Effective security is a team effort involving the participation and support of every user who interacts with company information/data and systems. It is the responsibility of each individual to help protect company information assets.

#LI-LH1 #LI-Remote

Click Here to view our Applicant Privacy Notice

jobs.title: Senior Back End Software Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Suzy is an AI-first SaaS platform transforming how businesses capture consumer insights. With Suzy 3.0, we’re building the next generation of our platform—anchored around Suzy Speaks, Suzy Signals, and AskSuzy—to deliver real-time, mobile-first feedback loops that help the world’s biggest brands move at the speed of culture.

Learn more at www.suzy.com.

Suzy is hiring a Senior Software Engineer of Back End development to help build out the Suzy platform. You will work closely with technical leadership and other developers to develop features, handle bugs and drive innovation. You will help to build out a robust architecture which processes hundreds of millions of records to support a real time market research platform. Additionally, you will develop and test the REST API layer, create and maintain client SDKs, and integrate with and automate third-party systems and technologies.

Responsibilities:

  • Coach and mentor engineers of all levels as you deliver on Suzy’s biggest challenges

  • Participate in long term planning of software architecture with an eye for scalability and maintainability

  • Own key products at Suzy and participate in triaging and solving high impact bugs

  • Be the example for high quality code which embraces a “shift left” engineering culture

  • Set the technical direction for assigned projects and act as a key resource for Product for long term planning, grooming, and sprint planning

  • Collaborate with Product, User Experience, and Subject Matter Experts to help Suzy achieve its vision for innovative market research solutions

Skills required:

  • Expert-level .NET development experience, encompassing the .NET Framework, .NET Core, and beyond

  • Demonstrated experience with git, or an equivalent distributed version control system

  • Strong experience with modern API architectures (e.g., REST, GraphQL, gRPC, real-time web sockets)

  • Experience with Command Query Responsibility Segregation (CQRS) architectures

  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server or Azure SQL Server, including schema design and query optimization

  • Advanced knowledge of Object Relational Mapping frameworks such as EntityFramework, EF Core

  • Experience with ElasticSearch, CosmosDB, or other comparable NoSQL databases

  • Experience with Test Driven Development using xUnit and Moq, or other comparable frameworks

  • Experience with cloud-native development, preferably Azure

  • Hands-on experience with Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 (ADLS Gen2)

  • Strong skills in Python for AI, scripting, automation, and data processing tasks

  • Solid understanding of ETL operations and data pipeline design

  • 1+ years of technical leadership, or equivalent experience

  • 7+ years designing and developing back end systems, or equivalent experience

Benefits:

  • We take care of our employees and their families. We have generous health dental and vision benefits, and our 401K plan vests immediately

  • A friendly, fun, and collaborative work environment that allows for frequent exposure to executives

  • The opportunity to make an immediate impact as a part of a fast-growing company

  • The target base compensation for this role is $160,000 - $185,000 / yr.

Suzy is an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to ensure all people feel supported and connected at work.

Suzy is committed to protecting its customers, employees, partners, and the company as a whole, from damaging acts that are intentional or unintentional. Effective security is a team effort involving the participation and support of every user who interacts with company information/data and systems. It is the responsibility of each individual to help protect company information assets.

jobs.title: Legal Operations & Technology Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Overview

Suzy, Inc. is an AI-first SaaS company looking for a Legal Operations & Technology Manager who can help us supercharge how the legal, compliance, and security teams operate. This role is not about paper-pushing or waiting for instructions — it’s about building, streamlining, and automating the way these functions deliver value across the company.

You’ll report directly to the General Counsel, driving projects forward with a get-it-done, tech-forward mindset. If you thrive on learning new tools, building workflows from scratch, and collaborating cross-functionally, this is the role for you.

We’re open to candidates from diverse backgrounds — legal ops, customer success, project management, RevOps, compliance, etc. What matters most is your ability to:

  • Learn and leverage new tech quickly (especially AI and automation tools).

  • Bring a self-starter, can-do, collaborative attitude.

  • Translate complex problems into simple, scalable processes.

Responsibilities

  • Tech & Automation Focus

    • Research, test, and deploy AI and legal tech tools to automate contract reviews, reporting, and workflows.

    • Build scalable processes (playbooks, trackers, dashboards) to reduce manual work.

    • Integrate Salesforce, shared drives, and other systems for contracts hygiene and metadata tracking.

    Core Ops Execution

    • Maintain contracts archive (MSAs, addenda, amendments, termination notices).

    • Log and track contract metadata (term, renewal, governing law, AI permissions).

    • Support order form workflows and contract lifecycle processes.

    • Centralize NDAs and build a searchable tracker for key terms.

    Cross-Functional Partnering

    • Document workflows and playbooks

    • Partner with Enablement, Sales, Tech, and Finance to streamline handoffs and processes.

    • Support compliance projects, IP portfolio tracking, and policy creation.

Qualifications

We care less about where you’ve been and more about what you can do. That said, success in this role likely requires:

  • Demonstrated ability to adopt and master new technology (bonus if you’ve used AI tools, Salesforce, or contract management systems).

  • Strong project management and organizational skills.

  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills; people enjoy working with you.

  • A bias toward action: you can take an ambiguous problem, figure it out, and deliver a solution.

  • High attention to detail paired with a builder’s mindset.

  • Experience in legal ops, RevOps, customer success, or similar process/ops-heavy functions is a plus — but not required.

Compensation & Logistics

  • Type: Contractor - Must have your own legal entity

  • Compensation: $45-55/hr.

  • Location: Remote (U.S.-based).
